METS_Profile.title: E-ARK SITS SIARD root METS Profile 1.0 (citssiard_v1_0)
METS_Profile.abstract: This is the profile for an root METS following the Specification for the E-ARK Content Information Type Specification for Relational Databases using SIARD (CITS SIARD). Its an extension of the E-ARK SIP profile which in its turn extends the CSIP and SIP profile.

resource_model.head: E-ARK CITS SIARD ROOT profile
resource_model.p: This profile together with the E-ARK CITS SIARD document describes the root METS document for an IP conforming to the E-ARK CITS SIARD.

description.head: METS Profile
description.p: The value is set to "https://citssiard.dilcis.eu/profile/E-ARK-SIARD-ROOT.xml".

description.head: Content Category
description.p: The `mets/@TYPE` attribute is set to the value "Databases".

description.head: Content Information Type Specification
description.p: The `mets/@csip:CONTENTINFORMATIONTYPE` attribute is set to the value "citssiard_v1_0".

description.head: Content Information Type Specification
description.p: The `mets/@csip:OTHERCONTENTINFORMATIONTYPE` attribute is not to be used.

description.head: METS header
description.p: The CITS SIARD root METS document metsHdr element should comply with metsHdr requirements in the CSIP profile.

description.head: METS header
description.p: The CITS SIARD root METS document metsHdr element should comply with metsHdr requirements in the SIP profile.

description.head: Descriptive metadata
description.p: The CITS SIARD root METS document dmdSecr element should comply with dmdSec requirements in the CSIP profile.

description.head: Descriptive metadata
description.p: The CITS SIARD root METS document dmdSec element should comply with dmdSec requirements in the SIP profile.

description.head: Administrative metadata
description.p: The CITS SIARD root METS document amdSec element should comply with amdSec requirements in the CSIP profile.

In CITS SIARD it is required that any rights or digital provenance metadata that is general to the package can be held within the root metadata folder and that any rights or digital provenance metadata that is specific to the data held in the representation should be held in the representation metadata folder.

description.head: Administrative metadata
description.p: The CITS SIARD root METS document amdSec element should comply with amdSec requirements in the CSIP profile.

In CITS SIARD it is required that any rights or digital provenance metadata that is general to the package can be held within the root metadata folder and that any rights or digital provenance metadata that is specific to the data held in the representation should be held in the representation metadata folder.

description.head: fileSec Representation Content Information Type Specification
description.p: There MUST be a minimum of one mets/fileSec/fileGrp[@USE='Representations']/@csip:CONTENTINFORMATIONTYPE with the value “citssiard_v1_0” as taken from the CSIP Vocabulary for Detailed Content Type that direct to the representation METS.xml in the representation folder containing a renational database.
The value of the attribute `mets/fileSec/fileGrp/@csip:CONTENTINFORMATIONTYPE` is set to "citssiard_v1_0".

description.head: fileSec Other Content Information Type Specification
description.p: For any mets/fileSec/fileGrp[@csip:CONTENTINFORMATIONTYPE with the value “citssiard_v1_0” there MUST be a @csip:OTHERCONTENTINFORMATIONTYPE attribute with a value taken from the vocabulary {SIARD_1.0; SIARD_2.0, SIARD_2.1, SIARD_2.2 Database_dump}.

description.head: Representation division
description.p: There must be a discrete representation `div` element for each representation.

description.head: structLink
description.p: Section not defined or used in CSIP, additional own uses may occur.
Information regarding the structural links is found in the METS Primer

description.head: behaviorSec
description.p: Section not defined or used in CSIP, additional own uses may occur.
Information regarding the behavior section is found in the METS Primer

description.head: fileSec Representation Content Information Type Specification
description.p: There MUST be a minimum of one representation and, therefore minimum of one Package METS.xml and a minimum of one Representation METS.xml in a CITS SIARD compliant package.

description.head: Type
description.p: If the value in representation mets/@csip:OTHERCONTENTINFORMATIONTYPE is {SIARD_1.0, SIARD2.0, SIARD2.1, Database_dump} then the Package METS.xml fileGrp who refers to the Package METS.xml MUST have the same value.

description.head: SIARD_1.0, SIARD2.0, SIARD2.1 file occuarance requriment
description.p: If the value in mets/@csip:OTHERCONTENTINFORMATIONTYPE is {SIARD_1.0, SIARD2.0, SIARD2.1} then there MUST exist a file named [databaseName].siard in representations/[RepresentationName]/data

description.head: SIARD_1.0, SIARD2.0, SIARD2.1 version requriment
description.p: The SIARD version of the SIARD-file MUST be the same as the version provided in mets/@csip:OTHERCONTENTINFORMATIONTYPE and fileSec/fileGrp/file@csip:OTHERCONTENTINFORMATIONTYPE

description.head: SIARD_1.0, SIARD2.0, SIARD2.1 file validation
description.p: The representations/[RepresentationName]/data/[databaseName].siard SHOULD be a valid SIARD file

description.head: SIARD_1.0, SIARD2.0, SIARD2.1 validation reports
description.p: There SHOULD be minimum of one validation report in the documentation folder for the validation of the SIARD-file

description.head: SIARD 1.0, SIARD2.0, SIARD2.1 file name
description.p: The file name of the SIARD file representations/[RepresentationName]/data/[databaseName].siard MAY be the short database identifier of the database as specified in the 'dbname' element of the metadata.xml file in the SIARD file, but it is not recommended.

description.head: SIARD 2.2 size implications
description.p: From SIARD2.2 and onwards If a .siard file is larger than a desired or imposed implementation limit then it MAY be physically split into file parts which are then placed in the same location that the .siard file would have been.
Each file part must have the suffix _part[nnn] with nnn beginning with 001.
In this case SIARD_15, SIARD_16, SIARD_17, SIARD_18 and SIARD_19 refer to the complete SIARD file as if it was re-assembled from the constituent parts.

description.head: SIARD 2.2 mapping file
description.p: From SIARD_2.2 and onwards If a mapping file is used to describe the physical location of segments then a file mapping.txt MUST be provided at the same location as the .siard file
See SIARD2.2 section S_8.1.2.0 for further information regarding its format.

description.head: Database dump file occuarance requriment
description.p: If the value in mets/@csip:OTHERCONTENTINFORMATIONTYPE is “Database_dump” then there MUST exist a proprietary database dump in representations/[RepresentationName]/data

description.head: SIARD lobs file placement requriment
description.p: If a database has LOBs outside the .siard-file then these SHOULD be stored in the same representation as the .siard-file

description.head: SIARD 2.2 lobs file placement requriment
description.p: From SIARD2.2 and onwards a manifest file MAY be used to increase interoperability to document LOBS stored outside the .siard file. In this case then a file manifest.txt MAY be provided next to the .siard file
See SIARD2.2 section S_8.1.3-0 for further information

description.head: SIARD 2.2 lobs file structure
description.p: LOBS that are located as per SIARD2.2 MUST confirm to a defined structure.
•A main LOB folder named [databaseName]_lobs
•A LOB folder for each column named after the schema no. i, table no. j, column no. k; i. e.: s[i]_t[j]_c[k]
•A folder named seg_0
•A LOB file named after the table no. j, column no. k and row no. l of the LOB i.e. t[j]_c[k]_r[l]
•A LOB file name suffix named bin (or a file extension associated with the MIME type of the lob file in case this is known (see restrictions under SIARD22 section P_4.2-6).)
See SIARD2.2 section L_7.1.0 for further information

description.head: SIARD 2.2 lobs file and zip use
description.p: The [databaseName]_lobs/seg_[]/ folders MAY be packaged as ZIP files, named with the suffix .zip
See SIARD2.2 section L_7.1-1 for further information
Requirements not stated in CITS SIARD

description.head: Database dump metadata requriment
description.p: There SHOULD be preservation metadata describing the proprietary database dump

description.head: Submission agreement requriment
description.p: There SHOULD be a submission agreement in the SIP representation that has been tailored to handle preservation of relational databases

description.head: Submission agreement number of representations requriment
description.p: The submission agreement SHOULD describe how many representations of the database that the Producer has to submit.

description.head: Submission agreement range requriment
description.p: The submission agreement SHOULD describe whether the submitted representations of a database is 1:1 with the running database (Full SIARD export) or if any alterations have been made (only a subset of tables)

description.head: Submission agreement table requriment
description.p: The submission agreement SHOULD list the tables that are required to be submitted to the archive and to be preserved.

description.head: Submission agreement SQL queries requriment
description.p: The submission agreement SHOULD list a set of SQL queries that are decided to be submitted to the archive and are to be preserved under the 'views'-element in metadata.xml.

requirement.RELATEDMAT: SIARD_29 SIARD_29a SIARD_30 SIARD_31 SIARD_32 SIARD_33

description.head: Submission agreement documentation requriment
description.p: The submission agreement SHOULD list the documentation that is decided to be submitted to the archive.

description.head: Documentation of tables etc. requriment
description.p: Tables, columns/fields, keys, coded values SHOULD be explained, preferably in the metadata.xml and via code tables or the SIARD file or alternatively in the Documentation folder.

description.head: Tables and columns created during the export
description.p: Tables and columns that did not exist in the original database layer (such as code tables created for archiving purposes) SHOULD be named with the prefix “Arch_” in metadata.xml

description.head: Documentation of system diagram requriment
description.p: There SHOULD be a system diagram in the Documentation folder. Preferably an Entity/Relationship Diagramme

description.head: Location of documentation of system diagram requriment
description.p: The system diagrams SHOULD be located in a subfolder called database_diagrams

description.head: Fileformat of system diagram requriment
description.p: System diagrams MAY be archived as PNG-files.

description.head: Naming of original database system diagram requriment
description.p: System diagrams visualising the original database SHOULD be named with the prefix “Original_”

description.head: Naming of archived database system diagram requriment
description.p: System diagrams visualising the archived database SHOULD be named with the prefix “Archived_”

description.head: Documentation of system dialogs requriment
description.p: The (main) system-user dialogues SHOULD be documented, down to the identification of the database columns/fields involved in the dialogues, documented as a combination of:
*Screenshots, annotated with column/field descriptions, stored in the Documentation folder.
*User documentation describing the system-user dialogue stored in the Documentation folder.
*Views, if available, as part of the SIARD file.
*If views are not present, additional descriptions of the system (application) logic, stored in the Documentation folder

description.head: Documentation of legal context requriment
description.p: Documentation of the legal context of the database and associated system SHOULD be provided in the Documentation folder.

description.head: Documentation of videos and or screen dumps requriment
description.p: There MAY be videos or screen dumps from the system as seen from the user’s point of view in the Documentation folder.
